issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Improve message when Authentication is required

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: As Aaron pointed out on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-7509?focusedCommentId=13126725&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13126725 I stupidly swapped CommonConfigurationKeys.HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION with CommonConfigurationKeys.HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHORIZATION.
fields.summary: I switched variable names in HADOOP-7509

comments.body: The committer can either mark this as dupe of the re-opened HADOOP-7509. Or use this JIRA to commit the patch. I'm sorry I don't really know what's more convenient to the committers. :( Sorry for this stupid error.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12498926/patchToCorrect7509.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/295//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/295//console

This message is automatically generated.
For branch-0.20-security

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12498933/patchToCorrect7509.branch-0.20.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/296//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1 for the patch.
I committed the patch. Thanks Aaron for catching the issue and thanks Ravi for fixing it.
